newsitem.title: UK: Rolls-Royce shares fall amid engine worries.
newsitem.headline: Rolls-Royce shares fall amid engine worries.

text.p: Shares in Rolls-Royce Plc fell 6-1/2 pence to 244 following concerns over the safety of the company's Trent 700 aircraft engine, dealers said.
Two Hong Kong airlines -- Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd and Hong Kong Dragon Airlines -- on Saturday grounded their fleet of aircraft powered by the Trent 700.
The move followed after a Trent 700 engine had failed earlier on a Dragonair Airbus A330 aircraft.
Rolls-Royce on Friday said it was working with its clients to solve the problem, which it said was in the engine's gearbox.
A company spokesman said there was no reason to pull out the engine, adding the problem should be solved and solutions tested within a month.
Airbus said overnight it was not likely to reconsider its business dealings with Rolls-Royce. -- London newsroom +44 171 542 7717
